understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB() which returns a long value.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to retrieving the index summary capacity in MB from the configuration. The configuration specifies a fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries, which can be obtained using the unclear code method.

config_description: A fixed memory pool size in MB for for SSTable index summaries. If left empty, this will default to 5% of the heap size. If the memory usage of all index summaries exceeds this limit, SSTables with low read rates will shrink their index summaries in order to meet this limit.  However, this is a best-effort process. In extreme conditions Cassandra may need to use more than this amount of memory.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'index_summary_capacity_in_mb' sets a fixed memory pool size in MB for SSTable index summaries. It is retrieved using DatabaseDescriptor.getIndexSummaryCapacityInMB() method and used to initialize the memory pool size for the index summary manager.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered during the initialization of the IndexSummaryManager class. It is set once during the initialization process and remains constant unless explicitly changed.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'index_summary_capacity_in_mb' configuration option is significant as it determines the memory pool size for SSTable index summaries. If the memory usage of all index summaries exceeds this limit, SSTables with low read rates will shrink their index summaries to meet this limit. This can affect the memory usage and performance of the system, especially in cases where the memory usage exceeds the configured limit.
